mainEntity.name: What types of trucks are compatible with Btracking’s fleet tracking system?

acceptedAnswer.text: Btracking’s GPS Truck Trackers are compatible with Class 6–8 commercial vehicles and connects via the OBDII or J1939 port using a plug-and-play harness. It’s built to support long-haul trucks, box trucks, and vocational fleets requiring real-time diagnostics and driver safety monitoring.

mainEntity.name: What vehicle and driver data does the truck GPS tracker collect?

acceptedAnswer.text: The system captures GPS location, speed, engine diagnostics (DTC codes), harsh braking, idling, acceleration, and cornering data. It also integrates with AI dashcams, Driver ID, and BLE sensors for a full view of driver behavior and vehicle health.

mainEntity.name: What if the truck travels through areas with no cell service?

acceptedAnswer.text: The system includes store-and-forward technology, which saves location and diagnostic data while offline and automatically uploads it once connectivity is restored—so no trip data is ever lost.

mainEntity.name: What are the advantages of using a truck fleet tracking system?

acceptedAnswer.text: Fleets using Btracking report up to 20% better vehicle utilization, 10% fuel savings, fewer maintenance issues, and improved driver accountability. The system offers powerful tools to reduce insurance costs, improve safety, and keep cargo secure in transit.
